level.heading: Death of respondent; liability of estate.
level.text: If the respondent dies after parentage has been established and prior to the time the child reaches the age at which the child ceases to be a minor, any sums due and unpaid under an order of the court at the time of his or her death shall constitute a valid claim against his or her estate.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 1-87
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 1-87, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 16-2341.
